Class TripleTriadModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • TripleTriadModel
  • public class TripleTriadModel
extends java.lang.Object
    Keeps track of the state of the game. Keeps track of all objects used to play and their attributes such as: The players scores, the players themselves, and the 3x3 Board which contains cards played by the player. The game is drawn from this model.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Keagen Thomson

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      Board board
      The 3x3 Board that player's play cards on and attempt to capture other cards on.
      (package private) ClickState clickstate
      An object that calculates if the clicks on a board are within the active player's hand and on a valid spot on the board.
      java.lang.String currentWinner
      Calculated based on score.
      boolean gameFinished
      Indicates if the game is finished based on the amount of cards that have been played to the board.
      Player[] players
      The player's of the game.
      int[] scores
      Scores is the scores of both players stored in an array where the 0th index is Player 1's Score and the 1st is Player 2's.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TripleTriadModel()
      Constructs the model representing the state of the game including the players and their relative attributes, the board and its played cards, whose currently winning, and if the game is finished already.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean attemptPlay​(java.awt.Point p)
      This method takes a mouse click location and tests (abstractly with the clickState class) if it is possible to make a valid play with the click.

      Returns the player object whose turn attribute is true.

      Getter for the board which contains all cards played and what spots a card played is adjacent to

      Getter for the game finished boolean.

      Getter for the player array which should contain two players
      int[] getScores()
      Getter for the scores array where the 0th index is player 1's score and the 1st is player 2

      This method makes a play after a click using the attemptPlay method to determine when this method should be called.
      void printTurns()
      Shows the players turns
      void toggleActivePlayer()
      Toggles the active player turn.
      void updateCurrentWinner()
      Checks the player score and sets the currentWinner attribute based on which is higher.
      void updateGameFinished()
      Checks every node in the board and if any node doesn't have a card then the game isn't finished.
      void updateGameState()
      Wrapper for all the play sensitive updater methods to be called after the board's state has changed.
      void updateScores()
      Instantiates scores AND updates scores.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • players

        public Player[] players
        The player's of the game. In a standard unmodified game this is two players Respectively "Player 1 and Player 2"

      • board

        public Board board
        The 3x3 Board that player's play cards on and attempt to capture other cards on. The board can hold up to 9 cards and knows which cards are adjacent to eachother

      • scores

        public int[] scores
        Scores is the scores of both players stored in an array where the 0th index is Player 1's Score and the 1st is Player 2's.

      • gameFinished

        public boolean gameFinished
        Indicates if the game is finished based on the amount of cards that have been played to the board.

      • currentWinner

        public java.lang.String currentWinner
        Calculated based on score. Can be "Player 1 ", "Player 2 " or "Draw, nobody "

      • clickstate

        ClickState clickstate
        An object that calculates if the clicks on a board are within the active player's hand and on a valid spot on the board. This is used when playing a card from the hand to the board by clicking both spots.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TripleTriadModel

        public TripleTriadModel()
        Constructs the model representing the state of the game including the players and their relative attributes, the board and its played cards, whose currently winning, and if the game is finished already. Contains methods to update the board's state after ever turn

    • Method Detail

      • getBoard

        public Board getBoard()
        Getter for the board which contains all cards played and what spots a card played is adjacent to

      • getPlayers

        public Player[] getPlayers()
        Getter for the player array which should contain two players

      • getActivePlayer

        public Player getActivePlayer()
        Returns the player object whose turn attribute is true. Since only one player can have a true turn attribute, that player is the one with an active turn.

      • toggleActivePlayer

        public void toggleActivePlayer()
        Toggles the active player turn. Meant to be used after a play is successfully made

      • printTurns

        public void printTurns()
        Shows the players turns

      • updateScores

        public void updateScores()
        Instantiates scores AND updates scores. called after a play before repaint.

      • updateCurrentWinner

        public void updateCurrentWinner()
        Checks the player score and sets the currentWinner attribute based on which is higher. this is called after every play and used when the game is complete. can possibly be used before the game is complete later.

      • updateGameFinished

        public void updateGameFinished()
        Checks every node in the board and if any node doesn't have a card then the game isn't finished. Updates after every play

      • updateGameState

        public void updateGameState()
        Wrapper for all the play sensitive updater methods to be called after the board's state has changed.

      • getScores

        public int[] getScores()
        Getter for the scores array where the 0th index is player 1's score and the 1st is player 2
        Returns:
        The array of scores for each player which is updated after every play

      • getGameFinished

        public boolean getGameFinished()
        Getter for the game finished boolean. Remains false unless all possible cards from both hands have been played. (Calculated by checking if every board square has a card) Used to trigger a game over message.

      • getCurrentWinner

        public java.lang.String getCurrentWinner()
        Getter for the current winner String Calculated based on score, and can either be Player 1, Player 2, or Draw, Nobody. Updated by its updater function after every play

      • attemptPlay

        public boolean attemptPlay​(java.awt.Point p)
        This method takes a mouse click location and tests (abstractly with the clickState class) if it is possible to make a valid play with the click.

      • play

        public boolean play​(java.awt.Point p)
        This method makes a play after a click using the attemptPlay method to determine when this method should be called. It also updates the model after a play is successful with information changed by that play such as score or the current winner and whether or not the game is complete
